intro: Pedicularis stapfii, commonly known as the Stapf's lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its showy, spurred flowers that typically range in color from pink to purple. It grows in rocky and alpine environments, often in association with coniferous forests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
